com.almasb.fxgl

Class GameScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.ui.FXGLScene
      • com.almasb.fxgl.GameScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorldStateListener

    public final class GameScene
extends FXGLScene
implements WorldStateListener
    Represents the scene that shows game objects on the screen during "play" mode. Contains 3 layers. From bottom to top:
    1. Entities and their render layers
    2. Particles
    3. UI Overlay
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • setViewportOrigin

        public void setViewportOrigin(int x,
                              int y)
        Sets viewport origin. Use it for camera movement.

        Do NOT use if the viewport was bound.

        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate

      • getViewportOrigin

        public javafx.geometry.Point2D getViewportOrigin()
        Note: viewport origin, like anything in a scene, has top-left origin point.
        Returns:
        viewport origin

      • bindViewportOrigin

        public void bindViewportOrigin(Entity entity,
                               int distX,
                               int distY)
        Binds the viewport origin so that it follows the given entity distX and distY represent bound distance between entity and viewport origin 

         Example:

 bindViewportOrigin(player, (int) (getWidth() / 2), (int) (getHeight() / 2));

 the code above centers the camera on player
 For most platformers / side scrollers use:

 bindViewportOriginX(player, (int) (getWidth() / 2));
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to follow
        distX - distance in X between origin and entity
        distY - distance in Y between origin and entity

      • bindViewportOriginX

        public void bindViewportOriginX(Entity entity,
                                int distX)
        Binds the viewport origin so that it follows the given entity distX represent bound distance in X axis between entity and viewport origin.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to follow
        distX - distance in X between origin and entity

      • bindViewportOriginY
